alert.note: Alert for East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 8:23PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Otero and northeastern Dona Ana Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 822 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles south of White Sands National Park to 7 miles southwest of Sunspot. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... White Sands National Park, Tularosa, Alamogordo, Burro Flats, La Luz, Holloman Air Force Base, Boles Acres, and Oliver Lee State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 186 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 50 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: East Central Tularosa Basin, Alamogordo; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet
